text: How would you say I want to eat?
Je veux manger.
I want to eat it.
Je veux le manger.
To say some or some of it in French, you will use the French word en.
It's spelled en and pronounced rather nasally like a lot of French words are.
So once more, the word for some or some of it is en.
How would you say to eat it?
Let's go back a moment and say that again.
To eat it would be le manger.
With that in mind, how do you think you would say to eat some of it?
En manger.
So, en means some of it and it goes in precisely the same place that le would.
Some students have the tendency to want to put le and en together.
So they will say something like le ont manger.
But en actually contains the it already.
So if you have le and en together, it would mean some of it it.
You would have two it's in the sentence.
So let's practice both of those again.
I want to eat it.
Je veux le manger.
Now I want to eat some of it.
Simply replace the le with en.
So I want to eat some of it.
Je veux en manger.
I want to eat some of it now.
Je veux en manger maintenant.
To sell in French.
What is to sell?
Vendre.
It's actually spelt V-E-N-D-R-E.
So it can help to remember it as really meaning to vend.
But pronounced in a French way.
So how would you say I want to sell it?
Je veux le vendre.
I want to sell some of it.
Je veux en vendre.
He wants to sell some of it.
Il veut en vendre.
Can you remember what to see is to see?
Voir.
I want to see it.
Je veux le voir.
I want to see some of it.
Je veux en voir.
What was I can?
Je peux.
I can see some of it.
Je peux en voir.
How do you think you would say I can't see any of it?
Je ne peux pas en voir.
Now you'll notice that in the English, the meaning of en has changed.
Because when we use something like that in a positive sense in English,
so when we say, oh, I can see some of it,
we will use the word some.
But the moment we make that sentence negative in English,
correctly, we can't actually use some anymore.
I mean, you might occasionally hear people saying,
I can't see some of it.
But that sounds a bit odd.
What we're far more likely to say is,
I can't see any of it.
So, we have a positive and a negative sense there in English.
I can see some of it.
I can't see any of it.
Really, we're talking about the same thing,
but we're just changing it from positive to negative.
In French, they use the same word.
In English, it might be simpler if we did that too, but we don't.
So, let's try that again.
I can see it.
So, you can see that on is translated in a variety of ways in English.
It's just something to get used to,
as the French really like to use it a lot.
And
Thank you.
